definitions: To quote or refer to (a passage, book, or author) as evidence for or justification of an argument or statement.
To mention (something) as an example or in support of an argument.
To officially commend (someone) for bravery or meritorious service in a military context.
To summon (someone) to appear in court.
examples: She cited three sources in her essay.
He cited the declining sales as a reason for the change.
The soldier was cited for his courage.
The police cited him for speeding.
